Title: Chapter 1: Dexterity
Notes: This chapter is meant to build up finger dexterity and to instil finger independence in the player. They can be used to warm up during your practice session or to improve finger control where you feel it is lacking. All the exercises in this chapter should be player with alternate picking unless specifically stated.

Lessons.Name: Dexterity 1 - Ascending Spider
Lessons.Notes: Play the pattern once on each string.

Lessons.Name: Dexterity 2 - Vertical Spider
Lessons.Notes: This is a classic chromatic exercise. It can be extended further by playing the 4 notes in every possible permutation, for a total of 24 variations

Lessons.Name: Dexterity 3 - Ascending Triplets
Lessons.Notes: Attempt to accentuate the first note of each triplet, this adds a new dimension to the problem, as you have to vary your picking strength in sync with the beat. It also means alternating accented notes on downstrokes and upstrokes.
Variations: Variation 1 - Index, Middle and Ring finger variation
Variation 2 - Middle, Ring and pinky finger variation

Lessons.Name: Dexterity 5 - Ascending Vertical Spider
Lessons.Notes: This is a continuation of Exercise 2.

Lessons.Name: Dexterity 6 - Two notes per string Spider Climb
Dexterity 7 - Two notes per string stretches
Dexterity 8 - Two notes per string stretches, downwards
Dexterity 9 - String crawl
Lessons.Notes: A somewhat confusing pattern that requires building up muscle memory to play perfectly

Lessons.Name: Dexterity 10 - Sweeping patterns
Lessons.Notes: Play these exercises with a sweep picking motion.

Lessons.Name: Dexterity 15 - Triple finger workout in Reverse
